title.narrative: ACCESS TO EDUCATION

description.narrative: By end 2017, government at all levels, with the support of NGOs and education institutions, implements school enrollment, drop-out prevention and second chance education strategies for children, especially Roma girls and children with disabilities, that are not enrolled in, that have dropped out or that are at-risk of dropping out of compulsory education, which contributes to Early Learning, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, more children from excluded and poor families benefit from equal access to education and protection systems

mailing-address.narrative: 87 A. Doundukov Blvd. Fl.2 Sofia 1504 Bulgaria P.O. Box 801

sector.narrative: Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities

related-activity.ref: 0570/A0/04/001 EQUITY AND SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR CHILDREN

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By end 2017, government at all levels, with the support of NGOs and education institutions, implements school enrollment, drop-outprevention and second chance education strategies for children, especially Roma girls and children with disabilities, that are notenrolled in, that have dropped out or that are at-risk of dropping out of compulsory education

description.narrative: The new Law on pre-school and school education fully implemented one year after its adoption; State Standard on Inclusive Education revised to address challenges with the implementation of inclusive education; modelling work for introducing IE in kindergartens and TA for the implementation of cross-sectoral approaches towards dropout prevention continued. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2017

title.narrative: Development of mechanisms for prevention of Roma girls' dropout from school and/or reintegration in education

target.value: 2017:Mechanisms developed and tested in at least one target region by 2017

actual.value: 2017:A Mechanism for cross-sectoral collaboration between the institutions is adopted and enforced at national level (CM Decision N373). An approach addressing gender roles and social norms is developed and ready to be pilot tested in 2018 as part of the Mechanism in the region of Shumen.

title.narrative: % of kindergartens and schools participating in inclusive education programmes in 3 target regions
Implementation of a strategy for prevention and decrease of the rate of school drop-outs

baseline.value: Draft strategy on reducing the share of early school leavers

target.value: 2017:Strategy adopted and 40% of the measures implemented by 2017

title.narrative: Legal provision available ensuring the right of ALL children to be educated in mainstream schools

target.value: 2017:New Education Act and Education Standards ensuring the right of ALL children to be educated in mainstream schools are implemented

actual.value: 2017:New Education Act and Education Standards ensuring the right of ALL children to be educated in mainstream kindergartens and schools are enforced. Standard on IE has been revised in 2017.

title.narrative: Legal provision available ensuring the right of ALL children to be educated in mainstream schools

target.value: 2017:New Education Act and Education Standards ensuring the right of ALL children to be educated in mainstream schools are implemented

actual.value: 2017:New Education Act and Education Standards ensuring the right of ALL children to be educated in mainstream kindergartens and schools are enforced.

title.narrative: Existence of a nation-wide mechanism to identify children of compulsory school age who are not enrolled and/or are not attending school

target.value: 2017:IMS for identification of children at risk of dropping out and children out of school is pilot tested in 9 municipalities

actual.value: 2017:Mechanism for cross-sectoral collaboration between institutions for enrolment and retention of children and students age 5-20 is adopted by Council of Ministers (July 2017) and applied nationwide.

title.narrative: Existence of a nation-wide mechanism to identify children of compulsory school age who are not enrolled and/or are not attending school

target.value: 2017:IMS for identification of children at risk of dropping out and children out of school is pilot tested in 9 municipalities

actual.value: 2017:Mechanism for cross-sectoral collaboration between institutions for enrolment and retention of children and students age 5-20 is adopted by Council of Ministers (July 2017) and applied nationwide.

title.narrative: Pre-service and in-service teacher training includes modules on special needs and inclusion issues

target.value: 2017:Modules on special needs and inclusion issues are developed and tested

actual.value: 2017:In-service training modules on special needs and inclusion issues are developed and tested with around 300 teachers,A minimum of 15 instruction hours on IE are required as part of core pre-service teacher training.

title.narrative: Proportion of schools nationwide using management information system enabling identification of non-enrolled children and analysis of the risk of dropout of vulnerable children
